title: Baked apples in a semolina soufflé
description: I adore this comforting pudding, which my mother baked regularly when I was a child. It is very easy to prepare and looks so inviting. The fruity baked apples provides a wonderful contrast to the soft melting soufflé. Try trickling a little maple syrup over the tops of the apples as you serve it.For this recipe you will need a 25cm/10in round baking dish (7cm/3in deep).
ingredients: 4 apples, such as Blenheim Orange or Chivers Delight, stalks intact
100g/3½oz caster sugar, plus extra for sprinkling
